file_content.text: Time is everything right now. I'll fill you in along the way.
I tried to reach you, to tell you--this won't end well.
The time for hand-wringing ended when you shut down the Orbital Defense Command Center, Agent.
No--before that. When I planted you with Theron Shan.
With respect, you haven't seen what I have on the ground. The power the Emperor holds--
I'm aware, Agent. Now, if you have a report on Sith Intelligence or the SIS, we can talk. But you will not tell me how to fight a war.
Damn. This is bad.
That is one way of putting it....
I take it you heard all that. Or enough of it.
Theron's relying on you while you're busy stabbing him in the back. What a piece of work.
Theron trusted you.
Lana holds you in such high esteem--her "rising star"--but you're little more than a talking dung worm.
Lana trusted you.
Are you still going to help me stop all this?
It doesn't matter.
You know what happens to traitors.
Prepare to die.
Had enough contracts from the Empire to figure they'll want to torture you before they kill you. Get ready for a carbonite nap....
You're done.
Wait! You can't. You need me. You need my help.
You pretend to work for Lana. I'm assuming the same relationship with Theron. So that makes three masters?
Interesting.
Do you even know which one you really work for anymore?
If we don't put a stop to Vitiate, none of that matters.
Your loyalties aside, the fact that you brought that war monger Saresh into all this....
You and Saresh messed up.
I didn't know how bad things were. None of us did.
I know I've made things worse. More innocents are dying because of me, and that's....
Please--let me help you.
This isn't over.
No. No, I wouldn't think so.
Yes.
Then that's that.
Okay, then. Let's proceed.
I know it looks bad. Okay, it is bad.
But listen, I have a plan to stall Vitiate's progress--at least for a while. It requires that we work together. Let me help you.
My number one goal right now is to stop Vitiate. Judge me all you want, but I'd rather it was while we were dealing with him.
